common

Class ByteValueConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.ByteValueConverter

  • public final class ByteValueConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class providing static methods for converting raw byte arrays to primitive types, strings, and RationalNumber representations, especially in the context of image metadata parsing, for example: TIFF or PNG.

    This class is non-instantiable and thread-safe due to its state-less and static design.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • containsNullByte

        public static boolean containsNullByte(byte[] data)
        Checks if the specified byte array contains a null (0x00) byte.
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array to examine

      • readFirstNullTerminatedByteArray

        public static byte[] readFirstNullTerminatedByteArray(byte[] data)
        Extracts a byte array segment terminated by the first null (0x00) byte.

        This method searches for the first occurrence of a null byte (0x00) in the specified data array. If a null byte is found, it returns a new array containing all bytes from the beginning of data up to, but not including, the first null byte. Any bytes after the first null terminator are ignored.

        If no null byte is found in the data array, a copy of the entire original data array is returned.

        Parameters:
        data - The input byte array to be searched for a null terminator. Must not be null
        Returns:
        A new byte array containing the segment before the first null terminator, or a copy of the entire original array if no null terminator is present
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the data parameter is null

      • readNullTerminatedString

        public static java.lang.String readNullTerminatedString(byte[] data,
                                                        int offset,
                                                        java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Reads a string from a byte array starting at the specified offset. The string is terminated by the first null (0x00) byte, or by the end of the array if no null byte is found.
        Parameters:
        data - the source byte array
        offset - the starting index
        charset - the charset to decode the string
        Returns:
        the decoded string, which runs until the first null byte (exclusive) or the end of the array. Returns an empty string if offset equals the array length
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the offset is out of bounds or the data is null

      • splitNullDelimitedStrings

        public static java.lang.String[] splitNullDelimitedStrings(byte[] data)
        Splits a byte array of null-delimited strings into individual strings using UTF-8.
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array to split
        Returns:
        an array of strings

      • readAllBytes

        public static byte[] readAllBytes(java.nio.file.Path filePath)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entire contents of the file at the given Path into a byte array.
        Parameters:
        filePath - a Path instance encapsulating the image file
        Returns:
        a byte array of the file's raw contents, or empty if file is zero-length
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be read

      • readAllBytes

        public static byte[] readAllBytes(java.io.InputStream stream)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads all bytes from the given InputStream resource and returns them as a byte array. Internally, it uses an 8 KB buffer for efficient reading, making it suitable for large streams such as files or network input.
        Parameters:
        stream - the input stream to read from
        Returns:
        a byte array containing all bytes read from the stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading

        public static short toShort(byte[] bytes,
                            java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Returns a signed 16-bit short based on the specified two bytes of data.
        Parameters:
        bytes - an array of 2 bytes or more
        order - the byte order for interpreting the specified bytes, using either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        Returns:
        the 16 bit short value

      • toUnsignedInteger

        public static long toUnsignedInteger(byte[] bytes,
                                     java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Reads a 32-bit unsigned integer value (4 bytes) from the given byte array, interpreting the bytes based on the current byte ordering.
        Parameters:
        bytes - an array containing 4 bytes or more
        order - the byte order for interpreting the specified bytes, using either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        Returns:
        an unsigned 32-bit integer value, ranging from 0x00000000 to 0xFFFFFFFF, masked as a long

        Returns:

      • toRational

        public static RationalNumber toRational(byte[] bytes,
                                        java.nio.ByteOrder order,
                                        RationalNumber.DataType type)
        Converts 8 bytes into a RationalNumber, using signed or unsigned type.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array containing numerator and denominator
        order - the byte order for interpreting the specified bytes, using either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        type - whether the values should be treated as signed or unsigned
        Returns:
        a new RationalNumber instance

      • toRational

        public static RationalNumber toRational(byte[] bytes,
                                        int offset,
                                        java.nio.ByteOrder order,
                                        RationalNumber.DataType type)
        Reads an 8-byte segment from the specified byte array at the given offset and converts it into a RationalNumber object. The first four bytes represent the numerator and the next four bytes represent the denominator, interpreted according to the specified byte order and data type (signed or unsigned).
        Parameters:
        bytes - a byte array containing at least 8 bytes from the offset
        offset - the offset at which to start reading the 8-byte segment
        order - the byte order for interpreting the specified bytes, using either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        type - indicates whether the values should be treated as signed or unsigned. It can only be either RationalNumber.DataType.UNSIGNED or RationalNumber.DataType.SIGNED
        Returns:
        a new RationalNumber object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the bytes array is null, the offset is out of bounds, or the array is too short to read 8 bytes starting at the offset

      • toUnsignedShortArray

        public static int[] toUnsignedShortArray(byte[] data,
                                         java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Convenience method for converting an entire byte array to an integer array using the specified byte order.
        Parameters:
        data - the input byte array
        order - the byte order to interpret the float values
        Returns:
        an array of integer values

      • toUnsignedShortArray

        public static int[] toUnsignedShortArray(byte[] data,
                                         int offset,
                                         java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Converts a byte array to an array of unsigned 16-bit integers, honoring the specified byte order.
        Parameters:
        data - the input byte array
        offset - the starting offset in the byte array
        order - the byte order for interpreting the specified bytes, using either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        Returns:
        an integer array containing the unsigned short values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input is null or has an invalid length

      • toIntegerArray

        public static int[] toIntegerArray(byte[] data,
                                   int offset,
                                   java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Converts a byte array to an array of signed 32-bit integers, honouring the specified byte order.
        Parameters:
        data - the input byte array
        offset - the starting offset in the byte array
        order - the byte order for interpreting the specified bytes, using either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        Returns:
        an int array containing the signed integer values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input is null, offset is out of bounds, or the remaining length is not a multiple of 4

      • toLongArray

        public static long[] toLongArray(byte[] data,
                                 java.nio.ByteOrder order)
        Convenience method for converting an entire byte array to a signed 64-bit long integer array, using the specified byte order.
        Parameters:
        data - the input byte array
        order - the byte order for interpreting the specified bytes, using either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        Returns:
        a long array containing the signed long values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input is null, or the length is not a multiple of 8

                                 int offset,

        Parameters:

        offset - the starting offset in the byte array
        order - the byte order for interpreting the specified bytes, using either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        Returns:
        a long array containing the signed long values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input is null, offset is out of bounds, or the remaining length is not a multiple of 8

      • toRationalArray

        public static RationalNumber[] toRationalArray(byte[] data,
                                               int offset,
                                               java.nio.ByteOrder order,
                                               RationalNumber.DataType type)
        Converts a byte array into an array of RationalNumber objects, interpreting each 8-byte segment as a numerator-denominator pair.
        Parameters:
        data - the input byte array
        offset - the offset in the array to start reading from
        order - the byte order for interpreting the specified bytes, using either ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN or ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN
        type - the rational number type (SIGNED or UNSIGNED)
        Returns:
        an array of RationalNumber objects
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if data is null or the length is invalid
